metadata.title: CVE-2024-35813 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mmc:core: Avoid negative index with array access Commit 4d0c8d0aef63 ("mmc:core: Use mrq.sbc in close-ended ffu") assigns prev_idata = idatas[i - 1],but doesn't check that the iterator i is greater than zero. Let's fix thisby adding a check.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35813` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1').

linux-aws-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-1128.138~18.04.1').
